result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan J. Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

with elements and criminal case settlement

Cases 13CM479 and 15CM303 called together at 3:03pm [mo]
Defendant Ryan J. Krueger in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
recess: 3:04pm--reconvene:3:17pm

ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance; provides a victim impact statement

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " No Contest " entered on Counts #2 and #3 of Case 15CM303; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #1 and #4 of Case 15CM303 and Case 13CM479

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Krueger

On Counts #2 and #3 of Case 15CM303, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:

--Mental health assessment and follow through with all mental health recommendations
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment if recommended by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol 
--no precense in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no acts or threats of violence
--Contact with Seth Bezanson per Agent and if he and agent agree
--On Count #2 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #3 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to submit a DNA sample to designee upon request 

Days credit for time already served:  1 day
recess:3:48pm

ADDRESS INFO for Ryan J. Krueger
Current: 106 S. 2nd St. Apt. 1, Watertown, WI 53094 United States  (Effective: 10-06-2015)
Prior: 1408 S 3rd Street, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States

Cases 13CM479 and 15CM303 called together at 8:12am [mo]
Defendant Ryan J. Krueger in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

As to the Defendant's Motion for Bond Modification:
--no objection from ADA Shock; questions logistics
--arguments given by Atty. Huebner

On 10/5/15 the Court makes an exception to Mr. Krueger's bond in case 15CM303:
The Court will allow Mr. Ryan Krueger, the Defendant to return one time to the residence that was once shared with Seth Bezanson, he can collect and take with him whatever it is that Seth Bezanson will allow him to take, the Court is not going to make a determination to what that would be, the Court authorizes Ryan Krueger to return to resiidence at a mutually conveinient time. When Ryan Krueger is present at the residence of Seth Bezanson law enforcement is to be present, the length of time is at the determination of law enforcement. 

The Court orders that the arrangements for the return to the residence are to made through a 3rd person.
recess: 8:28am
Sent to Defendant (1)Copy of Letter submitted on Def.'s behalf and Court's response//sent to LKA

Cases 13CM479 and 15CM303 called together at 2:41pm [mo]
Defendant Ryan J. Krueger in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance.

Atty. Huebner indicates that this hearing will no longer be a plea and sentencing as Mr. Krueger is not willing to accept the State's offer. 
The Court reviews the Court record. 
The Court directs the Clerk to schedule 13CM479 for FSSC and Jury Trial
The Court distributes its scheduling order. 
The Court notes that case 15CM303 will remain as scheduled
recess: 2:52pm

NEXT: (1) PTC on 10/28/15 at 10:00am (2)FSSC on 12/7/15 at 11:00am (3)Jury Trial on 12/10/15 at 8:30am
from non-party requesting the defendant be allowed to go to the apartment to remove his personal belongings

ADDRESS INFO for Ryan J. Krueger
Current: 1408 S 3rd Street, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States  (Effective: 08-27-2015)
Prior: 114 1/2 N. Water St, Watertown, WI 53094

Court's response to defendant's letter: the code of judicial ethics prohibits a Judge from receiving communications outside of court unless it is clear that all parties have been provided a copy of the communication.
Letter from the defendant requesting extension
Original Bond Document received from JESO on 8/21/15

Case called at 1:23pm [mo]
Defendant Ryan J. Krueger appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Svehlek indicates that Mr. Krueger is eligible for PD representation 
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant


The Court requires a $1,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--No Contact with Seth Bezanson or presence at any place that Mr. Bezanson may reside
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession of any dangerous weapons as defined by statute
--take all medications as prescribed
--Mr. Krueger may return one time to the residence shared with Mr. Bezanson, 114 1/2 N. Water St., Watertown, WI, to retrieve personal possessions, accompioned by law enforecement by 8/23/2015

recess 1:28 pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/2/2015 at 10:40am   (2) Status Conference on 10/20/15 at 10:30am
